titlestmt.titleproper: Milton Rubincam papers on the Pennsylvania Historical Junto 1942-1988
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Milton Rubincam papers on the Pennsylvania Historical Junto
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Milton Rubincam (1909-1997) was a prominent genealogist and the founder of the Pennsylvania Historical Junto, a society formed in 1943 which was dedicated to the promotion of scholarship about Pennsylvania and Pennsylvanians.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes the organizational records of the Pennsylvania Historical Junto, with meeting minutes, programs, and correspondence. These records included a complete run of "The Pennsylvanian" (1944-1959), the group's publication, which was edited by Rubincam. There are also records relating to the life and writings of Homer Tope Rosenberger, a friend of Rubincam's and a principal member and early president of the Junto. Bibliographies of both Rubincam's and Rosenberger's printed works are included. In addition, there are photocopies of primary source materials relating to Gilbert Cope and the Faust (Foust) family.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
